p: It is noteworthy that CHIKV isolated from some of the European autochthonous cases lacked the A226V substitution in E1 [ 19, 20, 21], indicating that other factors or mutations can determine the virus adaptation to Ae albopictus. Indeed, substitutions in the E2 and E3 genes have also been involved in the process [ 22, 23]. These mutations are suggested to enhance the infection in the mosquito midgut, probably altering the entry process at the fusion step in the endosome [ 23, 24].
